Key Match Events: Jos Buttler will become the second player to reach 100 men's T20Is for England after Eoin Morgan
Dawid Malan has dominated Sodhi during their previous meetings in T20Is, hitting 105 runs off the 58 balls
Pre-Game Insights: England are in must-win territory against New Zealand in replay of last year's semi-final
New Zealand will still be well-placed even if they lose, though they would likely need to beat Ireland to ensure their progress
England's batters have targeted Ish Sodhi whenever they have faced him in T20Is
New Zealand might consider bringing Michael Bracewell in to counter England's left-hand batters
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was on the slow side in Australia's win against Ireland on Monday, and the same strip will be used on Tuesday, which could bring spinners into play
The forecast for the match is not the best, with rain due to fall throughout Tuesday morning, but the weather is expected to clear up later in the day
New Zealand have never played a T20I at the Gabba, and have a poor historic record there across formats
Others: The teams will be looking to overcome the rain and get a full 40 overs in
Lockie Ferguson doesn't expect New Zealand to make any major adjustments to their style of play against England
Paul Collingwood is hoping for a dry evening at the Gabba after the washout against Australia at the MCG
